name: Hotel Villa Real

reviews.title: Good value & excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Nice, but not a five star hotel
Very good location with several options on things to do!

reviews.text: There are not very many hotels in the world where all you need to do when you check in is to pick up your key card, and off you go to your room. That is great service. Well, maybe it is because I have stayed in this hotel many many times the last decade. Still, one cannot ignore this service.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel for the last 10 years - great location (near Puerta del Sol and Prado) and consistently good service.

reviews.text: The rooms are not large but they are comfortable. Sometimes they place two beds when I need one king size bed, but generally these beds are comfortable and the pillows are plentiful.
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect location

reviews.text: The hotel is somewhere in between Prado and Puerta del Sol. If you are a jazz afficionado, it is also close to the Plaza de la Angel where Cafe Central is located (just off the square). There is nightly live jazz in Cafe Central and generally the acts are from top local artists.
reviews.title: great location, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not expect, however, a great breakfast. Sometimes the coffee can be bad. And sometimes the staff can be Kate in replacing th buffet items. But the dishes are well made and of sufficient variety.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - recommended

reviews.text: Kubi wireless is available for Internet connection but it is not for free. It is also sometimes difficult to connect.
reviews.title: amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we spent a week at this hotel (4 - 11 March). We very much enjoyed our first visit and we were not disappointed this time either. The hotel is comfortable, central and close to the main galleries and the railway station which is our main reason for choosing this hotel. We did not try the restaurant but had an excellent breakfast every day which it would be difficult to beat. Our room had view over Plaze de las Cortes which was entertaining and not as noisy as I had expected although I would recommend airplugs for a quiet night. (Last year we had a room with view towards the back, not particularly attractive but quiet.) The hotel has several lifts and we never had to wait any length of time for the lift to arrive. Service was friendly and polite and there is a computer in the reception area which can be used by residents foc.
reviews.title: A reliable, friendly hotel in an excellent position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were offered a very good price at this hotel and enjoyed our stay there. It is directly across from the Spanish Parliament and a short walk to the Prado, etc. Rooms are a good size with a comfortable sitting area. Windows over the square are good at blocking noise and there is a fan on the AC/heating system which also helps. We had stayed overlooking the courtyard one night but slept poorly because of restaurant noise. Overlook the square instead. Test your beds because some of them are incredibly "squeaky." (Once we changed rooms, all was well.)
reviews.title: Five stars in most areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts are lovely - an excellent buffet - and the staff is helpful and very kind.
reviews.title: Nothing wrong with the place but just disappointing

reviews.text: I was really excited about going to this hotel from the pictures and reviews but very disappointed when I got there.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.text: The locations great, but the rooms looked average to me, more of a 4 star than a 5 star even taking the European difference into consideration. It was an expensive choice but didn't live up to the cost. On arrival our room was twin beded, not double as requested and confirmed in an email prior to arrival although this was quickly solved the next day, even through we were meant to be arriving late, the hotel still chose to count it as a no show and charge the booking card (which we shouldn't have paid against due to it being work/leisure visit). We didn't really have a problem with the standard of the hotel as such but just didn't feel it lived up to its reputation or price.
reviews.title: Large soulless rooms which weren't the cleanest

reviews.text: The Hotel Villa Real was 100 Euros a night cheaper than the Westin and essentially the same location. This hotel is very close to the Prado, and also within walking distance of most attractions in the old city.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff. Great value for a central location.

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and spoke flawless English. (This was helpful because even though I speak "beginners Spanish", there are questions like "do you have a power converter" that I have no idea how to say in Spanish. By the way, they did have a converter and loaned it to me for several days thoughout the week.) On my last day, I had to check out before the breakfast buffet began. They delivered a coffee, yogurt, and a few croissants to my room without charging me room service to make up for the fact I was leaving before the breakfast was served. What fantastic service!
reviews.title: Great, centrally located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Excellent staff, clean, beautiful, great location, large rooms (for a city)
reviews.title: Great choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: About the only con I have was that the walls were a little thin. So, do not talk loudly on your cell phone for an important business call.
reviews.title: Great location. Friendly staff.

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Noisy!!! Don't go there if you need to sleep well or work

description: The Villa Real is a five-star hotel in the centre of Madrid, located in the Plaza de las Cortes, right in front of the Spanish Congress of Deputies and just a few minutes on foot away from Puerta del Sol. It is a unique location for exploring the sites of 'Madrid de los Austrias' on foot and enjoying the museum triangle formed by the Museo del Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum and the Queen Sofia Foundation.
